definitions: in the direction in which a stream or river flows

examples.text: the car had floated some way downstream
the valley where I lived was downstream from coal mines
the bridge spanned the river just downstream of the rail line

shortDefinitions: in direction in which stream or river flows

definitions: in or toward the part of a sequence of genetic material where transcription takes place later than at a given point

examples.text: a termination signal was found downstream from the coding region

shortDefinitions: in or towards part of sequence of genetic material

definitions: at a stage in the process of gas or oil extraction and production after the raw material is ready for refining

examples.text: the company is bigger downstream, deriving a larger slice of its revenues from refining and marketing the oil it finds

shortDefinitions: at stage in process of gas or oil extraction

definitions: situated or moving in the direction in which a stream or river flows

examples.text: deforestation could have disastrous consequences for downstream regions

shortDefinitions: situated or moving in direction in which stream or river flows

definitions: situated in or toward the part of a sequence of genetic material where transcription takes place later than at a given point

examples.text: many of the protein gene sequences in this study appear to end with a single T that is directly adjacent to the downstream gene

shortDefinitions: situated in or towards later part of sequence of genetic material

definitions: taking place at or relating to a stage in the process of gas or oil extraction and production after the raw material is ready for refining

examples.text: a government regulation on the oil and gas downstream sector was issued

shortDefinitions: taking place at or relating to stage in process of gas or oil extraction
